author: butek
msg: Now that I've started using JavaUtils.getMessage, I discovered that ParseException
IS NOT a RuntimeException.  I was just listing it in the throws clause as a form of
documentation, assuming it WAS a RuntimeException.  But it's not needed and it
would require callers of getMessage to explicitly catch it, which is bad.  The javadoc
for java.text.MessageFormat is a bit wrong and misled me.

author: butek
msg: Make sure the messages properties file is in axis.jar.
